mahāpanāda： mahāpanāda（pu）
မဟာပနာဒ（ပု）
[mahanta+panāda]
[မဟန္တ+ပနာဒ]

Mahāpanāda：1．Mahāpanāda． Son of Suruci and king of Mithilā．He owned a palace one hundred storeys high，all of emerald； it was one thousand bow-shots （twenty five leagues） high and sixteen broad and held six thousand musicians．

Mahāpanāda was a previous birth of Bhaddaji．See the Mahāpanāda Jātaka and also Kosalā．See also Sankha （3）．

2．Mahāpanāda． A primeval king，descendant of Mahāsammata．Mhv．ii．4； Dpv．iii．7．

mahāpanāda：မဟာပနာဒ（ပု）
[မဟန္တ+ပနာဒ]
မဟာပနာဒမည်သူ။
